item.title: Spirit Airlines files for bankruptcy for 2nd time in less than a year
item.description: The budget carrier filed for fresh bankruptcy protection months after emerging from a Chapter 11 reorganization. The airline said it plans to keep flying as usual during the restructuring process.

item.title: As drug deaths hit a 5-year low, Trump continues to cite fentanyl as major threat
item.description: Drug deaths in the U.S. are at their lowest level since March 2025, according to federal data. Trump continues to cite fentanyl as justification for policies ranging from tariffs to immigration.

item.title: 3 dead after mob sets fire to Indonesian regional parliament building
item.description: An angry mob set fire to a local parliament building in an Indonesian provincial capital, leaving at least three people dead and five others hospitalized, officials said.

item.title: At Trump's urging, Missouri jumps into redistricting race to help Republicans
item.description: Gov. Mike Kehoe called a special session starting Wednesday to help the GOP hold onto Congress. It's part of the battle to reshape the voting map and help Trump keep a majority for his agenda.
